docs.snippet: Colleges and sports teams that love to celebrate their history have become masters at editing it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Colleges and sports teams that love to celebrate their history have become masters at editing it.
docs.abstract: College and professional sports teams have become adept at cleansing historical records of former players who have run afoul of rules or the law; recent Heisman ceremony, during which no mention was made of controversial 2005 winner Reggie Bush, provides strong example of such whitewashing.

headline.main: O.J. Who? Rogues Vanish From Annals of Sport
